result.execSummary:
The defendant Caine M Soman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be paid within 60 days of 6/16/2016. If not paid within 60 days a commitment order will be issued, consecutive to current sentence.

The defendant must obtain his GED.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No contact with Dalton Bird.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Caine M Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Caine M Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:14 AM. Called 16CF34 and 16CV07. State - resolved on 16CF34 and 16CV07 is set for STC. State - 16CF34 - plead G to count #1 as alleged with enhancer, #2 - amend to 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety contrary to 941.30(2) with same enhancers and PTAC, DRI remaining counts (#3, #4, #5 and #6), joint recommendantion of 49 months in the WI State Prison System consisting of 13 months of initial confinement followed by 36 months of Extended Supervision - credit for 142 days, conditions of ES have not been discussed and Joy will be arguing for earned release and challenge incarceration. Joy and Soman agree. Court amends count #2 to 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety contrary to 941.30(2) with all enchances attached - reads new charge and penalty. Soman pleads G to count #1 as alleged and with enhancer and count #2 as amended. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3, #4, #5 and #6. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - State moves to offer squad video as exhibit #1 - received after no objections (11:31 AM). Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks for Court make him eligible for any prison programs available. Soman withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1  -  37 months in the WI State Prison System consisting of 13 months of initial confinement followed by 24 months ES; count #2 - 49 months in WI State Prison System consisting of 13 months of initial confinement followed by 36 months of ES - concurrent to each other - credit for 142 days, conditions of ES include: costs plus surcharges on each count - to be paid within 60 days of today/CO (consecutive CO time), maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no consumption of possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED, no contact with Dalton Bird, 200 hours of community service on each count - concurrent to each other, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, submit DNA sample, not making him eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program, right to appeal, adjourned. Called 16CV07 at 11:50 with same appearances. Joy states that they are stipulating to the repossession of the vehicle used in the crime. State agrees. Court grants state's request for judgment in favor of the State and orders forfeiture of the vehicle, State will submit order in regards to that.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Caine M Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Caine M Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:56 PM. State - here for FPT. Joy - not resolved - has gone over Frye with the defendant and he undertands the circumstances from rejecting the plea. State - plead to count #1 as alleged, amend #2 and #3 to second degree recklessly endangering safety as PTAC contrary to 941.30(2) - class G felony, DRI counts #4, #5 and #6, PSI requested with both parties free to argue. Joy and Soman agree. Court makes sure defendant understands rejection of plea, continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
State

No consumption of alcohol, no use of firearms, no operation of a motor vehicle.

Defendant Caine M Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Caine M Soman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:52 PM. State calls Officer Darrel Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 3:54 PM. Direct exam by State. Joy cross examines, 4:03 PM. Wilson excused at 4:09 PM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, sets for FPT. Joy - bond - asks for lower cash bond ($10,000.00) for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - reduces bond to $10,000 cash with same conditions. Joy to file something in civil matter to get that stayed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
From Attorney Cveykus in regards to his client, DB, not testifying at PH for this case.
Motion hearing at 03-09-2016 03:30 pm
defendant
Not called on the record. Attorney Joy is working with JA for new date.
DB
Preliminary hearing at 03-09-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Caine M Soman in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Caine M Soman in custody anbd appears via video from FOSO.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:18 AM. Joy and Soman have complaint as well as amended complaint, Joy waives reading of original complaint but has not gone over the amended complaint with the defendant. Soman does have a copy of the amended complaint. Court reads the additional charge. Joy and Soman understand amended complaint, waives further reading of it, requests PH, waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH. Joy wants to be heard on bond - expecting civil forfeiture forthwith with the defendant's vehicle - requests $5,000.00 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - continue bond for stated reasons. Court continues bond and will take it up again at PH/ARGN.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm. Total bond will be $25,000.00 and vacate the $1000.00 cash that was set on the latest probable cause.

No consumption of alcohol, no operation of a motor vehicle, no use of firearms.

Defendant Caine M Soman in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:45 PM. Soman has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Soman understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney but has not had a chance to contact one yet. Court finds the defendant is not eligible for SPD or court appointed. Court sets for AIA and informs defendant not to return to court without one. State - bond - $25,000.00. Court - bond - $25,000.00 bond. Court set $1,000 cash on the new probable cause with no consumption of alcohol. On this matter, no consumption of alcohol, no operation of a motor vehicle, no use of firearms.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
